body.name: Thermalright Intel 12/13th Generation LGA1700 Anti-Bending Buckle,Curved Pressure Plate,CPU Fixing Buckle,CPU Stress Bending Correction Fixer, Fully Fitted and Fixed Without Trace Installation (Black)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 23 mins
features: 【Advanced Technology】A fixed corrector developed for intel 12th/13th generation CPUs that get bent. All aluminum alloy anodized process, CNC manufacturing anodized sandblasting, perfect avoidance of capacitors, giving you the ultimate installation experience.

【Insulation foot pad】Adopt LOTES original same specification insulation protection feet. Fitted pressure, even pressure edge, multiple installations will not wear the CPU cover, combined with the cpu cooler and fan to get rid of high temperature troubles.

【Specification】54x70x6mm, all aluminum, 20g main body, 55g overall, comes with L-shaped screwdriver and TF7 2g, easy to install while giving CPU heat dissipation, Carefully designed to fit the CPU and support the weight of the cooler to prevent the CPU from being bent, black version
【Easy to install】An L-shaped screwdriver is included for easy installation of LGA1700-BCF onto the CPU. It is recommended to watch the video operation for successful one-step installation.
【Support Specifications】Intel 12th/13th generation CPU, motherboard CPU slot for LGA1700 chipset for H610, B660, Z690 series

reviews.reviewText: Use this to prevent CPU bend on motherboard as part of PC build after seeing recommendation on YouTube. Works like a charm and provides rigidity for CPU around entire CPU (even force distribution)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install and in theory should do a much better job holding the chip in place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This thing is awesome
reviews.reviewText: So apparently new intel processors have a long term bending problem I heard from YouTube reviews and thanks to one of those reviews I found out about this device. So there are two designs this guys sell and randomly ship. According to listing it’s just art changes but the one I got says is lga 1700 and I gotta I am very impressed with build quality. There are more expensive options out there and I did try them but guess what, it’s the exact same thing don’t waste your money. This product is good enough as is. CPU temps seems to get in control and well and best thing is my cpu will not have bending issue long term so I am happy that my 600 dollar cpu will not get damaged long term. Good luck gamers and get this product instead of that other expensive option. It’s just the name up charge no quality difference.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install
reviews.reviewText: I liked the ease of use and potential for reduced cpu thermals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My Intel 13700k was running very hot after putting a new build together. After a bit of research I purchased one of these thermal plates. It was super easy to install and solved my problem instantly. Very surprising something so simple is this effective.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It does what it says - a better processor hold-down.
reviews.reviewText: I never liked the original hold-down. It's easy to use, but I'm an engineer and I just don't like the way the standard hardware fits. I also had one core always a little warm. I wouldn't have changed anything, but I wanted to replace the slightly noisy RGB fans on my 360mm AIO cooler with BeQuiet 3s, so since I was going to be dragging the cooler out I decided to install this too. No problems removing the old one, and just a tiny bit of extra care needed in fitting this. It is very precisely the right size, so you need to be sure that it is sat down properly. At first it seemed right, but a slight shift and it dropped down the final mm and locked in place. The original screws secure it without any feeling of crushing, but when done the processor has no movement anywhere. After re-attaching the cooler the system fired right up. With the change of fans and use of a fan controller the processor is running cooler and I don't have anything getting close to throttling. This is only a minor part of the solution, but better safe than sorry. Worth the 'investment'.
